text: [Music]
I'd put my finger on three uh that
really reveal at this broad level the
decline of our um not only our the moral
standing of our culture elsewhere but
also the um just the social fabric of
our culture one UNICEF study
2004 ranked the social well-being of
children in 21 industrialized nations uh
and this is in terms of their happiness
and their health and their connection to
friends and physical health um and we
ranked 20th out of 21 and so uh if
cultures are judged by how they take
care of vulnerable individuals we're not
fairing well a second is the literature
on trust trust is this amazing glue of
social bonds facilitated by oxytocin
Vagas nerve regions of the nervous
system we study and uh the degree to
which American citizens trust each other
has dropped precipitously in 15 years uh
now this is pre-obama and I suspect uh
there's been a a a boost significant
boost and third all the data on where
our culture stands in the eyes of other
cultures is unequivocal and we have
dropped we've plummeted uh as a a nation
to respect uh in the past eight or 10
years so um those are pretty strong
indicators of where we
are I see spiritual tradition and
spiritual organizations as derivative of
something more basic that we've lost
which is uh what people like
confucious uh and other and what you see
in streams of Buddhism have really
cultivated which is an
everyday set of intuitions and ethics
that build up strong communities and
these are things like you know just the
rudiments of respect toward others uh
being affectionate you know we've talked
about it today uh being complimentary
sacrificing the self for others um those
are all things that Evolution has

look at those indicators of our poor
cultural health
I put my finger on the decline of of
emotions like gratitude and compassion
and reverence uh in our
culture as an empiricist and as a
scientist I'd want to see the data and I
know that uh a lot of the anti-anxiety
drugs work um and so you have to take
have faith in that um and you also have
to know you know the prev vence of the
depressions and the anxieties in our

and how powerful those conditions are uh
you want things that can mitigate those
symptoms in the short term and so my
take on the rise of those um particular
drugs is that uh we have to meet these
cultural anxieties in some fashion but
um again you know um I I by the way I
problematize that you know um it gets
too easy uh we start medicating kids
with young nervous systems with untested
drugs that's bad news and uh that I
worry about and if my daughters if one
of my daughters uh had a real a deep
source of anxiety or a depression uh or

everything that's possible before
turning to drugs um I I think there
symptoms of you know the isolated age we
